t: Psalm 104
God the Creator
My*pn soul, bless the Lord*s !Lord*s my God, you are very great; you*ln are clothed with majesty and splendor.
He*ln wraps himself in light as if it were a robe, spreading*ln out the sky like a canopy,
laying*ln the beams of his palace on*ln the waters above, making*ln the clouds his chariot, walking*ln on the wings of the wind,
and*ln making the winds his messengers, flames*ln of fire his servants.
He*pn established the earth on its foundations; it*ln will never be shaken.
You*ln covered it with the deep as*ln if it were a garment; the*ln water stood above the mountains.
At*ln your rebuke the water fled; at*ln the sound of your thunder they hurried away—
mountains*ln rose and valleys sank— to*ln the place you established for them.
You*ln set a boundary they cannot cross; they*ln will never cover the earth again.
He*pn causes the springs to gush into the valleys; they*ln flow between the mountains.
They*ln supply water for every wild beast; the*ln wild donkeys quench their thirst.
The*ln birds of the sky live beside the springs; they*ln make their voices heard among the foliage.
He*ln waters the mountains from his palace; the*ln earth is satisfied by the fruit of your labor.
He*pn causes grass to grow for the livestock and*ln provides crops for man to cultivate, producing*ln food from the earth,
wine*ln that makes human hearts glad — making*ln his face shine with oil — and*ln bread that sustains human hearts.
The*pn trees of the Lord*s flourish, the*ln cedars of Lebanon that he planted.
There*ln the birds make their nests; storks*ln make their homes in the pine trees.
The*ln high mountains are for the wild goats; the*ln cliffs are a refuge for hyraxes.
He*pn made the moon to mark the festivals; the*ln sun knows when to set.
You*ln bring darkness, and it becomes night, when*ln all the forest animals stir.
The*ln young lions roar for their prey and*ln seek their food from God.
The*ln sun rises; they go back and*ln lie down in their dens.
Man*ln goes out to his work and*ln to his labor until evening.
How*pn countless are your works, Lord!*s In*ln wisdom you have made them all; the*ln earth is full of your creatures.
Here*ln is the sea, vast and wide, teeming*ln with creatures beyond number — living*ln things both large and small.
There*ln the ships move about, and*ln Leviathan, which you formed to play there.
All*pn of them wait for you to*ln give them their food at the right time.
When*ln you give it to them, they*ln gather it; when*ln you open your hand, they*ln are satisfied with good things.
When*ln you hide your face, they*ln are terrified; when*ln you take away their breath, they*ln die and return to the dust.
When*ln you send your breath, they*ln are created, and*ln you renew the surface of the ground.
May*pn the glory of the Lord*s endure forever; may*ln the Lord*s rejoice in his works.
He*ln looks at the earth, and it trembles; he*ln touches the mountains, and*ln they pour out smoke.
I*ln will sing to the Lord*s all my life; I*ln will sing praise to my God while I live.
May*ln my meditation be pleasing to him; I*ln will rejoice in the Lord.*s
May*ln sinners vanish from the earth and*ln wicked people be no more. My*ln soul, bless the Lord!*s Hallelujah!*ln
